  Item 7.01  Regulation FD Disclosure.  
                                        
Capital One Financial Corporation (the
“Company”) has posted the summary of its
annual stress test results required by the
Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer
Protection Act of 2010 on its website
(http://www.capitalone.com). Under “About”
choose “Investors” to access the Investor
Center and then choose “Capital One Stress
Test Results” to view the current summary. The
disclosure includes stress test results for
the Company but does not take into account any
capital actions the Company may have requested
under the Federal Reserve’s 2020 Comprehensive
Capital Analysis and Review process (“CCAR”).
The furnishing of the Dodd-Frank Act Stress
Test results by the Company should not be
taken as an indication of the Company’s
performance as a part of the Federal Reserve
administered stress tests, and no positive or
negative inference regarding the Company’s
capital plan (including any potential capital
actions) should be drawn from this
information. The Federal Reserve has indicated
that banks should publicly disclose their
Stress Capital Buffer results after markets
close on June 29, 2020. Note : Information in
this report furnished pursuant to Item 7.01
shall not be deemed to be “filed” for the
purposes of Section 18 of the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934 or otherwise subject to
the liabilities of that Section. This report
will not be deemed an admission as to the
materiality of any information in the report
that is required to be disclosed solely by
Regulation FD.
